result.execSummary:
The defendant Shyla A. Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request approved $100/down and $50/month to quash warrant
to Court from Shyla A Ward
of Warrant cancellation in Custody MASO
Defendant's copy of Notice of Certification was returned undeliverable - Unable to Forward per USPS

Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Shyla A. Ward in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF43 & 15CFR68 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that there is an agreement on 15CF43 but there is not an agreement on 15CF68 and that will have to be set for a Prelim.  

15CF43: Atty Hende moves to amend the charge to Misd. Failure to Report.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to that amended charge.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Atty Gumz has checked with Adams County Jail and Ms. Ward is on a Probation hold.  Defendant enters a No  Contest plea to the amended charge.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended charge.


BY THE COURT:  Amended Misd. Failure to Report:  Court orders 120 days in the Marquette County Jail; consecutive to any other sentence
Report Forthwith
May serve in Columbia County or Adams County
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in March

15CF68:  
BY THE COURT:  Court will amend the bond; No contact will be removed.  
Set for Prelim.

Atty Gumz asks that the committment be cancelled in 15FO74 and that the amount due be incorporated into the payment plan.  
BY THE COURT:  So ordered.

Return date at 02-03-2016 02:30 pm
- Mailed Defendant's to Adams County Jail
Return date at 01-07-2016 01:45 pm

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF43 & 15CF68 tracking:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant lives about 2 hours away and had a trouble with getting a ride; she could be here tomorrow.  Atty Hendee has no objection to reset the matter.

BY THE COURT:  Reset. 
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Return date at 12-16-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states there are new charges set for Monday.  Requests matter be set for further return.  Atty Gumz states his client does have new allegations.  
BY THE COURT:  Set this for return and the new charges on Monday will track.  Return date scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
State's
Return date at 10-21-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Shyla A. Ward in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.     Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 08-05-2015 10:00 am
*No special conditions

Defendant Shyla A. Ward in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was served her criminal complaint yesterday.  Court questions the defendant.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant is serving her sentence; based on that, the State does not object to a signature bond.
Court verifies the defendant's address.

BY THE COURT: Court sets a $500 Signature bond; no special conditions.

Court questions the defendant regarding the time limits for the Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:   Time limits waived; Set Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
CANCELLATION FROM MASO
